Text.Title: Prepend Prompt
Text.HelpText: Added before the prompt. Useful with formulas.

Text.Title: Append Prompt
Text.HelpText: Added after the prompt. Useful with formulas.

Number.HelpText: Controls randomness: Lowering results in fewer random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive.

Number.Title: Maximum Length
Number.HelpText: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Requests can use up to 2,048 or 4,000 tokens shared between prompt and completion. The exact limit varies by model. (One token is roughly 4 characters for normal English text.)

Text.Title: Stop Sequence
Text.HelpText: Up to four sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens. The returned text will not contain the stop sequence.

Number.Title: Top P
Number.HelpText: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling: 0.5 means half of all likelihood-weighted options are considered.
How much to penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far. Decreases the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

Number.Title: Presence Penalty
Number.HelpText: How much to penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far. Increases the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

Number.Title: Best Of
Number.HelpText: Generates multiple completions server-side, and displays only the best. Streaming only works when set to 1. Since it acts as a multiplier on the number of completions, this parameter can eat into your token quota very quickly — use caution!

Number.Title: Delay Between Requests (ms)
Number.HelpText: The delay between requests in milliseconds. This is useful when you want to avoid hitting the API rate limit.
